comments:
Students had overwhelming praise for Dr. DiIulio, including many students stating that he is the best professor they have taken at Penn.  Evaluators noted that his passion for the material clearly shows and that he is genuinely excited about teaching it to students.  “Impressive” guest speakers were appreciated by the students.  Two major complaints were issued about the course.  The first was that the tests were strictly multiple choice and did not give students an opportunity to fully demonstrate their knowledge.  The second was that without a recitation students never had an opportunity to think critically and discuss/argue about course concepts.  
*Note:  Less than 25% of students submitted written evaluations for this class
